Package polyglot.ast

Class StringLit_c

java.lang.Object
polyglot.ast.Node_c
polyglot.ast.Term_c
polyglot.ast.Expr_c
polyglot.ast.Lit_c
polyglot.ast.StringLit_c
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Expr, ExprOps, Lit, Node, NodeOps, Prefix, Receiver, StringLit, Term, TermOps, Typed, Copy<Node>
public class StringLit_c
extends Lit_c
implements StringLit
A StringLit represents an immutable instance of a String which corresponds to a literal string in Java code.
See Also:
Serialized Form

      public Node typeCheck​(TypeChecker tc) throws SemanticException
      Description copied from interface: NodeOps
      Type check the AST. This method is called by the leave() method of the visitor. The method should perform work that should be done after visiting the children of the node. The method may return this or a new copy of the node which will be installed as a child of the node's parent.

    • breakupString

      protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> breakupString()
      Break a long string literal into a concatenation of small string literals. This avoids messing up the pretty printer and editors.
